pageContext.description: Bevelling around blade edges has almost disappeared. The edge round hilt plate from shoulder to shoulder has been filed, thus altering the outline. (Pommel end filed flat). The four large rivet holes have been redrilled. Two smaller ones (one broken into) have not. 4th central rivet hole modern (JDC).
pageContext.patina: Black & whitish green & metal showing through on one face.
pageContext.collection: Museum of Archaeology & Ethnology, Cambridge,Bronzes 91 (Numbers to be found in a volume entitled "Museum of Archaeology"),Prehistoric Bronzes No. 2 (Catalogue is lost.)
pageContext.remarks: Labelled: R.86.14, Bronze Sword, Ely, W.K. Foster, Esq.
